texts.fr: Seyni est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il exerce en même temps les activités d'agriculture et d'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine.Ces deux activités lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de satisfaire les besoins alimentaires, de santé et vestimentaires de sa famille. Afin d'acheter deux boeufs, il sollicite un pret de 300000f.Il ambitionne d'agrandir ses activités.
texts.en: Seyni is a married man and the father of three children. At the same time, he works in farming and raises cattle in particular. These two activities bring in the revenues enabling him to meet his needs in terms of food, health care, and clothing for his family. To buy two head of cattle, Seyni is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs. His ambition is to expand his businesses.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle

loans.name: Ninoska

texts.es:
La socia Ninoska pertenece al banco comunal LAS HIJAS DE MARIA;la socia continua trabajando en su negocio de  venta de licores, la socia trabaja en su negocio todos los dias siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia;la socia desea que su negocio poco a poco prospere.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de gaseosas y cerveza para su negocio.

La socia agradece el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas mensales.
texts.en:
Ninoska belongs to the communal bank “Las Hijas de María” (Daughters of Mary).   She has a shop that sells liquor.  She works in her business every day in order to build a better life for her family. She enjoys this business, which is going well thanks to the effort she makes every day.  She wants to build her business little by little.

She is seeking this loan to buy soda and beer for her business.  She is thankful for her previously granted loan and promises to complete her monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer for resale.

loans.name: Jose Emegidio

texts.es:
Jose tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja en una aldea del municipio de nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. 
Anteriormente Jose se dedicaba a la agricultura ahora dedica medio tiempo para realizar el negocio de compra y venta de todo tipo de animal, como ser vacas, terneros, cerdos, aves y otros. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y ya es muy conocido en la aldea donde tiene sus clientes. El préstamo que solicita es de 6,000.00 Lempiras y lo necesita para comprar más animales como terneros para vender. Este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar las ganancias. Su idea es hacer crecer el negocio para darle oportunidad de trabajo y mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 26 years old and lives with his partner in a neighborhood in the town of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. He was a farmer previously, but now he works part-time at his business of buying and selling all types of animals, such as cows, calves, pigs, poultry, and other livestock. Jose has been in this business for four years and is well-known in the neighborhood where he has customers.

He is requesting a loan of 6,000 HNL because he needs to buy more animals, such as calves, that he can sell. This loan will help to increase his earnings. His intention is to grow his business so that he can provide job opportunities and improve his family's life.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Veenem Yangue Group

texts.fr:
Mme ELISE  est la responsable du groupe VEENEMYANGUE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des pagnes depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au  grand marché de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les hommes, femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 03 douzaines de pagnes. 

Mme réinvestie ses économies  dans son activité. Elle ambitionne  avoir un lieu fixe pour faire son activité et pouvoir plus aider sa famille.
texts.en:
Mme ELISE  is the leader of the group called VEENEM YANGUE. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 12 and the youngest two years old. Two of them attend school and she is responsible for four persons. 

Elise has been selling lengths of African print cloth for seven years. She buys her wares at the big market in Ouagadougou. Her customers are men and women. 

She wants to buy three dozen lengths of African print cloth.  

Elise reinvests her savings in her business. Her ambition is to have a shop where she can sell her goods and to do more to help her family.

loans.use: to buy three dozen lengths of African print cloth

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Todos Juntos“ perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de verduras, desde hace 3 años. Trabaja en un local que instalo en su casa, trabaja todos los días, a veces le ayuda su hijo.
Comenta que sus insumos los compra en la feria, y otras veces los compra en distribuidoras de abastecimiento en verduras, ya que son lugares en los cuales encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conviene económicamente. 
Con el crédito comprará mercadería.
Una de sus metas es poder terminar su local para atender a su clientela en forma ordenada.
Patricia vive junto a su marido, un hijo y un nieto, sus sueños a nivel familiar son terminar su local para una mejor calidad de vida y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con el grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, lo cual la motiva a seguir participando en la institución. Comenta además que las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en: Patricia belongs to the communal bank "Todos Juntos" ("All Together") of the city of Viña del Mar. She has been selling vegetables for 3 years. She works out of a shop that she set up in her house. She works every day, sometimes with the help of her son. She says that she buys merchandise at the market or to distributors specialised in vegetables, since both offer low prices and are thus convenient from an economic standpoint. With this loan she will buy merchandise to sell. One of her goals is to be able to finish her shop in order to welcome customers in a tidy fashion. Patricia lives with her husband and has a son and a grandson. Her goals for her family are to finish her shop in order to have a better quality of life and thus be able to increase her income. She is very glad and thankful for the opportunity afforded her by field partner Fondo Esperanza, since the loan will allow her to invest in her business. She also feels at ease in the communal bank group she belongs to, which motivates her to continue to participate. She also says that the training imparted during group meetings has helped her to better invest in her business. Viña del Mar is a city and commune situated in the middle of the Chilean coastline; it is known as 'the Garden City' because of the gardens and courtyards displayed by some of the antique buildings in the city. It is also deemed the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Yanett Del Pilar

texts.es:
La socia Yanett Del Pilar pertenece al banco comunal LAS HIJAS DE MARIA ; la socia continua trabajando en su negocio de venta de artesanía ella vende lo que son chompas,polos,guantes,entre otros;la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia;la socia vende de forma ambulatoria distribuyendo su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a  su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como chompas de alpaca.

La socia se siente agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Yanett Del Pilar belongs to the Las Hijas de Maria (Daughters of Mary) Communal Bank.  The member continues working in her business, selling artesanal crafts.  She sells sweaters, polo shirts, gloves, and other crafts.  She has been in this business for a good while and it’s going well thanks to the effort she makes each day.  She makes her sales on foot distributing her merchandise to customers who request it.  In this way, she helps her family get ahead.  She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise, such as alpaca sweaters, for her business.  Yanett is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments according the established terms.  .

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as alpaca sweaters, for her business.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 27-year-old married man with one child aged two. He looks after two dependents whom he pays school fees for and buys their scholastic materials.

Henry is a primary school teacher at a mission school in his village where he earns a meagre salary. He does agriculture to supplement his income.  He started teaching in 2007 because it was his dream job and works six days a week. He wants 700,000 Ugandan shillings to complete payment on a piece of land where he has already made partial payment.     

He hopes to buy more land and build himself a presentable house. Henry loves success, and whenever he fails to achieve his goals, usually because of a lack of funds, he feels frustrated.  He is a hard working man.

loans.use: to complete payment on a piece of land.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a young man of 28 years. He is married and has two children who are five years old and five months old. The five-year-old boy is in kindergarten. Kenneth also stays with his younger brother and sister for whom he pays tution for university and high school, respectively.

Kenneth has a small furniture workshop where he makes tables, cupboards and beds on a small scale. He also makes local wood varnish and sells it. He employs two boys who help him in making the above. He makes an average profit of UGX 400,000 per month, depending on the season.

Kenneth wants UGX 3,000,000 to complete payment for a piece of land in the outskirts of the city, on which he has already made partial payment. He wishes to start constructing a house for his family if he gets funds so that he can stop renting, which eats into his income and yet he has many family demands.

His main challenge is that at times he buys poor quality wood that cracks before he uses it when there is a lot of sunshine or during transportation of the furniture.

Kenneth is a very hard working young man, which is the reason he has been able to send his siblings to school. In the picture is Kenneth on the land he is buying.

loans.use: To complete payment for a piece of land.

loans.name: Flor Nacional Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Flor Nacional” está conformado por 15 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran;  venta de ropa usada, venta de ropa nueva, venta de pan amasado, venta de flores,almacen, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo  ubicado en la ciudad de Santiago.
Lorena, secretaria del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en segunda fila ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste chaleco negro, su cabello lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio en ventas de ropa nueva de gran variedad para su clientela, se ocupa de este negocio desde hace 2 años, trabaja con su esposo.
La mercadería que va necesitando para su negocio la compra en distribuidoras de ropa en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería chalecos, buzos, poleras de diferentes tallas y modelos .
Las metas en su negocio son seguir creciendo para poder tener otro puesto. Lorena vive junto a su marido y sus 2 hijos y no de sus sueños son tener una casa propia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos, existe respeto y confianza.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is named "Flor Nacional" and consists of 15 entrepreneurs who engage in different trades.  These businesses include selling used clothing, selling new clothing, selling "pan amasado" (Chilean kneaded bread), selling flowers, managing a store, providing services, and other activities.  All of the members are from the community of San Bernardo, which is located in the city of Santiago.

Lorena is the secretary of this Communal Bank group.  In the photograph, she is seated in the second row and in the first position (from left to right).  She is wearing a black jacket and has her hair down.  Lorena is in the retail trade, selling a wide variety of new clothes to her customers.  She has been in this business for two years.  Lorena works with her husband.  The merchandise she needs for her business is purchased from clothing distributors in the city of Santiago.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise.  Her goals for her business include continuing her growth so that she can open another vending post.  Lorena lives with her husband and two children.  She dreams of having a house of her own.  Lorena is pleased with and appreciative of the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business.  In addition, she feels comfortable participating in her group since the members are unified, respectful, and trustworthy.  

San Bernardo is a city that is located 18 kilometers due south of the main square in Santiago (the Chilean capital).  It is known as the folklore capital since it hosts the International Folklore Festival every January.  This event highlights the various ethnic groups of the country and musical groups from all over South America gather there. Chilean artisans, as well as those from other countries nearby, also participate in the Traditional Craft Fair. In the month of April, an event called "Abril Cuecas Mil" celebrates the "cueca" (a traditional Chilean dance) throughout the entire community.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like vests, track suits, and t-shirts of different styles and sizes.

loans.name: Abatiganda 9 Zone 2 / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Elias fait partie du groupe Abatiganda Zone 2/Rsz. Le nom du groupe signifie «les courageux». Il a 46 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 6 ans à 16 ans, dont 4  scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Elias est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisant et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz.


Pour faire croitre son agriculture de riz, il planifie d’utiliser des fertilisants sélectionner et sollicite d’autres crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait acheter d’autres champs pour agrandir l’étendue de son agriculture. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants et sa famille en général.
texts.en:
Elias is a member of the group Abatiganda Zone 2/Rsz. The name of the group means “the brave”. Elias, age 46, is married with five children aged 6 to 16, four of whom go to school. He attended six years of primary school. 

Elias is a rice farmer. This is his third loan cycle with ACB, and he plans to use the credit to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.  

Elias plans to expand his activity by obtaining additional loans and using selected fertilizers. In the coming years, he would like to acquire more fields to increase his farmable area. He will use the profits earned to pay for his family’s healthcare and his children’s tuition.

loans.use: to use the credit to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Soñadores Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Soñadores” está conformado por 17 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, preparación y venta de comida rápida, juegos en maquinas de azar, repostería, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la cuidad de San Antonio.
Ingrid quien en la foto se encuentra sentada ocupando el primer ligar de izquierda a derecha, vistiendo pantalón gris, polera blanca y encima lleva un chaleco color negro, usa una cartera color café, su cabello es de color negro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa y juegos de maquinas de azar, desde hace 1 año. Su local lo ubica en su propia casa.
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en la cuidad de Santiago, ya que es mucho más conveniente y con mayor variedad.
Con el crédito comprará una maquina de juegos de azar y mercadería para la venta de ropa.
Sus metas son tener un local en el centro de la ciudad de San Antonio, para generar mayores ingresos.
Ingrid vive junto a su marido y su hija pequeña. Sus sueños a nivel familiar son tener su local para optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Ingrid está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
San Antonio es un puerto de la región de Valparaíso, siendo esta una de sus principales características, ubicado en el litoral central de Chile. Se desarrolla en forma importante la pesca y venta de pescados y mariscos. Pese a la actividad portuaria y comercial del puerto, existe un alto índice de cesantía.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Soñadores.” It is made up of 17 enterprising people who work in commerce, specifically in clothing sales, preparation of fast foods, video games, gambling machines, baking, and services, among other things. All of them live in the city of San Antonio.

Ingrid, in the photo she is first from the left, dressed in gray pants, a white sweater, and over that a black coat, has a brown purse, her hair is black, and she is wearing it back.

She has been selling clothing and also has had gambling machines for 1 year. Her business is located in her own house. She usually buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago because it is much more convenient and has a large variety.

With the loan, she will buy a gambling machine and clothing merchandise.

Her goal is to have a store in the center of the city of San Antonio, so that she can earn a larger income. Ingrid lives with her husband and their young daughter. Her dream for her family is to have a store so that they can have a better quality of life.

Ingrid is very happy and grateful for the loan and the services provided by Fondo Esperanza. She also explains that she feels very comfortable in the meetings and her communal bank, because the members are generous and united. 

San Antonio is a port in the region of Valparaíso. It is characterized by being a port city and being located on the central coast of Chile. Fishing and fish and seafood sales are important industries. Despite the port and commercial activities, there is a high rate of unemployment.

loans.use: to buy a gambling machine and clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Avanzar Todos Juntos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Avanzar Todos Juntos” está conformado por 15 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, venta de chocolates artesanales, tejido, artesanía, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes la comuna de La Florida ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Katherine quien en la foto se ubica en la parte del fondo cerca de la pared de izquierda a derecha, ella es morena y su cabello de color negro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio en venta de ropa, se ocupa de este negocio desde hace 8 años.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago por la gran variedad y lo económico.
Con el crédito comprará ropa para abastecer su negocio.
Las metas en su negocio son crecer con su local para tener mucha clientela.
Katherine vive junto a su marido y 2 hijos y uno de sus sueños son poder tener una casa propia, y terminar sus estudios para optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Katherine está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos.
La Florida es una comuna ubicada al suroriente de Santiago, capital de Chile, región Metropolitana. Su población actual es muy diversa, representando a todos los sectores socioeconómicos (alto, medio alto, medio y medio bajo). La zona cuenta con una activa vida comercial, la que se manifiesta en la existencia de varios nuevos centros comerciales. Es un sector que ha tenido un explosivo crecimiento demográfico en los últimos años.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Avanzar Todos Juntos” [Everyone Advance Together]. It is made up of 15 enterprising people who work in commerce, such as: clothing sales, artisanal chocolate sales, weaving, crafts, and services, among other things. All of them belong to the commune [a type of administrative district in Chile] of La Florida, located in the city of Santiago.

Katherine, who is located in the back of the photo, near the wall, near the middle, has darker skin and has black hair that she wears back. 

She works in the business of selling clothing. She has been doing this since she was 8 years old. She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago because there is a lot of variety there and it is economical.

With the loan, she will buy clothing to stock her business. Her goal for her business is to grow it and have many customers.

Katherine lives together with her husband and 2 children. One of her dreams is to have her own house and to finish her studies so that she can have a better quality of life.

Katherine is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that she has been given by Fondo Esperanza to invest in her business. She also feels very comfortable in the group in which she participates because they are close.

La Florida is a commune located in the southeast of Santiago, the capital of Chile, in the region of Metroplitana. Its current population is very diverse and represents all of the socioeconomic sectors (upper class, upper middle class, middle class, and lower class). The area has a lot of commercial activity, which is manifested in the many new shopping centers. It is an area that has had explosive demographic growth in the last few years.

loans.use: to buy clothing to stock her business

loans.name: Aidai

texts.ru:
Айдай 45 лет, вдова, воспитывает 3 детей. Айдай в качестве основного  источника дохода для своей семьи, с 2008 года занимается торговлей строительными материалами, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 30,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня доход от бизнеса составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айдай обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на расширение ассортимента товаров.  Доходы от кредита Айдай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса чтобы иметь возможность обучить детей в ВУЗе.
texts.en:
Aidai is 45 years old. She is a widow and is raising 3 children. As the main source of income for her family, Aidai sells construction materials, having launched her business in 2008 with an initial investment of 30,000 som (KGS). Presently, her profits total approximately 10,000 som (KGS) per month.

In order to continue developing her business, Aidai has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS), which she will use to expand the assortment of her merchandise. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business, so as to be able to pay for post-secondary education of her children.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of her products

loans.name: Ashirbubu

texts.ru:
Аширбубу 54 года, вдова, воспитала 2 детей. Аширбубу работает в пельменном цехе и качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1985 года занимается земледелием, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня доход от бизнеса  в выращивании фасоли  и ее реализации составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аширбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку минеральных удобрений.  Доходы от кредита Аширбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Ashirbubu is 54 years old, a widow, and has raised 2 children. She works at a dumpling factory and also cultivates crops in order to provide an additional source of income for her family. Ashirbubu started this business in 1985 with an investment of 10,000 som (KGS), and presently earns around 10,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of beans.

In order to continue developing her business, Ashirbubu has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase mineral fertilizers. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Gilda

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 7 filhos e todos ainda frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de roupa diversa, e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (fraldas, biquínis, chapéus, guarda chuvas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja construir quartos de aluguer, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo e solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a subida de preços de material de construção e elevado custo de vida.
texts.en:
She's married and has seven children, all of which still attend school. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She runs her own business selling various types of clothing. With the present loan she intends to purchase merchandise (diapers, bathing suits, hats, umbrellas, etc.) in order to stock up.
In the future she wishes to build rooms for renting. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled and request more loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is the rising prices of construction supplies and the high living costs.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for selling (diapers, bathing suits, hats, umbrellas, etc.).

loans.name: Mario

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos e todos ainda frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus sobrinhos que vivem com ele. 	
Trabalha como segurança e nos tempos livres faz a construção civil, e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, chapas, pedra e outros) para aumentar a sua casa e oferecer melhor conforto a sua família.
No futuro pretende apostar muito na formação dos seus filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo e solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é concluir a sua casa e oferecer melhor conforto a toda sua família.
texts.en:
He's married and has four children, all of which still attend school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports his nephews who live with him.
He works as a security guard and during his free time he does construction work. With the present loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, metal sheets, rocks, etc.) in order to enlarge his house and provide more comfort for his family.
In the future he intends to invest a lot in his children's education. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled and request more loans from Hluvuku.
His challenge is to finish building his home and to provide more comfort for his entire family.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, metal sheets, rocks, etc.).

loans.name: Karen Yesenia

texts.es:
Karen Yesenia tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada, y tiene 2 hijos, vive en una colonia periférica de  San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Karen tiene un negocio de venta de comida, ella vende desayunos, almuerzos, baleadas, pollo con tajadas etc. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa y los clientes son los mismos vecinos o personas que pasan por la zona. Dice que le va bien con el negocio, porque la comida siempre tiene mucha demanda a diario. En algunas ocasiones también vende comida por encargo. 
Para  mantener el negocio dando una buena atención a los clientes solicito un préstamo a Odef de 10,000 lempiras para comprar los insumos necesarios para elaborar los alimentos como carnes, condimentos, granos, refrescos, también otra parte para comprar utensilios nuevos para cocinar los alimentos para dar una mejor higiene y calidad en la preparación de los mismos.
Comenta que esta agradecida con ODEF y KIVA por la oportunidad en otorgarle el préstamo para que su negocio mejore.  Su plan es aumentar sus ventas para obtener más ingresos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Karen Yesenia is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a an outlying neighborhood of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Karen has a business selling food. She sells breakfast, lunches, "baleadas" (Honduran stuffed tortillas), chicken with fried plantains, and other dishes. This business is established in her house and her customers consist of neighbors and people passing through the area. Karen says that she is doing well in her business because her food is always in demand each day. On a few occasions, she will sell food made to order.

In order to maintain her business and provide good service to her customers, Karen is requesting a loan from ODEF in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that she can buy the necessary supplies for preparing food such as meats, condiments, grains, as well as soft drinks. Part of the loan will also be used to buy new utensils for cooking food so that her dishes will be of quality and prepared under better sanitary conditions. Karen says that she is grateful to ODEF and Kiva for the opportunity to obtain this loan so that she can improve her business. Her plan is to increase her sales so that she will have more income to help improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Cinthia Solange

texts.es:
Cinthia es una joven de 21 años de edad, desde pequeña sus padres le enseñaron lo que es ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente y por ello ella es muy trabajadora, vive al lado de su esposo y juntos tienen 3 pequeños de 1,3 y 6 años a quienes ama muchísimo y por los cuales da la vida con tal de darle una buena calidad de vida sobre todo con mucho amor. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta bailar y lo hace junto a sus pequeños a manera de distraerse, en ocasiones también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”. Debido a que sus padres no tenían muchos recursos económicos ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Administración. 

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Cinthia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos plásticos, en especial plásticos para cubrir techos en épocas de lluvias, plásticos decorativos para mesas, entre otros, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque su puesto de venta se encuentra en un lugar muy transitado y sobre todo porque trata con mucha amabilidad a los clientes.

Cinthia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más productos plásticos para vender en su negocio, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos my tendrá más productos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y una buena calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Cinthia, 21, is a young woman whose parents taught her what it meant to earn your livelihood with the sweat from your brow when she was little and because of that she’s very hardworking.  She lives with her husband and they have three little ones who are 1, 3 and 6 years old who she loves very much and for whom she gives her life in order to provide them with a good quality of life above all with much love.

When she has any free time available she likes to dance and she does so with her little ones to entertain herself.  On occasion she also likes to eat one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Lomo Saltado.” Because her parents did not have many economic resources, she only attended secondary school but would have liked to have studied Administration.

With mush effort and dedication Cinthia works in her business selling plastic products, especially plastic to cover during the rainy season and decorative plastic for tables, among others.  She spends about 9 hours per day at work and can take care of up to 10 customers in a day.  She believes that she does well in her business because her sales stand is located in a very busy spot and above all because she treats her customers very politely.

Cinthia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy more plastic products to sell in her business and improve her income this way.  She will have more products to offer her customers which will make it possible for her to continue striving towards making her greatest dream a reality: to give her children a good education and a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sonia Dominga

texts.es: Doña Sonia, tiene 52 años de edad, casada y vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara, quien hace aproximadamente 10 años estableció su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como azúcar, jugos, papel higiénico, arroz, manteca, refrescos, especias, huevos y otros. Poco a poco con dinero propio lo ha surtido. Actualmente solicita un préstamo por 10,000.00 para comprar más productos y mantenerlo surtido para ofrecer a sus clientes e incrementar las ventas. De las ganancias quiere cultivar más café ya que tiene una pequeña finca también.
texts.en:
Sonia, 52, is married and lives with her husband and four children in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  She started her own grocery store about 10 years ago where she sells food items like sugar, juice, toilet paper, rice, lard, soft-drinks, spices, eggs and others.  Little by little she’s stocked it with her own money.  

She’s currently asking for a 10,000 lempira loan to buy more products to keep it stocked to offer her customers and to increase sales.  From profits she wants to grow coffee because she also has a small farm.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 1 irmão que vive com ele. 	
Trabalha como bar man, e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material (blocos, cimento, areia, pedra, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro concluir a sua casa e construir uma ferragem, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é organizar um negócio próprio.
texts.en:
Married with two children that attend school, Alfredo lives in his own home with his family and one brother who also lives with them.

He works as a bar man, and with this loan he plans to buy materials (blocks, cement, sand, stone, and similar) to continue the construction work on his home.

In the future, he will finish his home and build a hardware shop. He is committed to properly repaying the loan in order to request further loans from Hluvuku.  The challenge is to start his own business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (blocks, cement, sand, stone, and similar) to continue the work on his home.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 1filho ainda menor de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe enviando algum valor monetário para as despesas alimentares. 	
É militar quadro do Ministério da Defesa, e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes, cimento, areia, chapas, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa e oferecer melhor conforto a sua família.
No futuro pretende terminar a sua casa e casar oficialmente, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo e solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é concluir a sua casa, continuar com os estudos e crescer profissionalmente.
texts.en:
She's single and has one underage son. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports her mother by sending some money for food expenses.
She's a servicewoman for the Ministry of Defense. With the present loan she intends to purchase construction supplies (beams, cement, sand, metal sheets, rocks, etc.) in order to continue building her house and to provide more comfort for her family.
Int he future she intends to finish building her home and to get officially married. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled and request more loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is to finish building her house, to continue her studies and to grow professionally.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (beams, cement, sand, metal sheets, rocks, etc.).

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es: Elsa Marina, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en el municipio de Trinidad Santa Bárbara. Ella anteriormente realizaba trabajos de costurado de zapatos y hace un año decidió fabricar cajas de cartón para zapatos. Este producto lo vende en los talleres de zapatería de la comunidad y sus alrededores. Es el segundo préstamo que solicita y es por 12,000.00 lempiras, que lo necesita para la compra de materia prima que utiliza para la elaboración de cajas para zapatos, como ser cartón, grapas y grapadoras. Ella quiere ver un buen crecimiento en su negocio, y estar unida con su familia y sentir que su negocio es propio.
texts.en:
Elsa Marina, 33, is married living with her husband and her three children in the municipality of Trinidad, Santa Bárbara.  She used to work sewing shoes and a year ago decided to manufacture cardboard boxes for shoes.  She sells the product to shoe shops in the community and adjacent areas. 

This is the second loan she’s requested.  It’s for 12,000 lempiras that she needs to buy raw materials she uses to make the shoe boxes like cardboard, staples and staplers.  She wants to see good business growth and to be united with her family and to feel that her business is her own.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es:
Ana Leticia tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, tiene 1 hijo y vive en el municipio de las Vegas, Peña Blanca, Cortes.
Ana, muy trabajadora, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la producción de café,  banano y maíz, los cuales vende en el mercado local. El café lo vende en pergamino húmedo, el banano por tallo y el maíz por quintal. Toda su familia se ha dedicado  a producir porqué es una forma de vivir , poderse desarrollar y educar a sus hijo,  pues donde ellos viven es una zona apta para esta producción y además la venta de café esta siendo un negocio muy rentable en el país. 
Este préstamo es el primero que solicita de 12,000 lempiras y es para invertirlo en la siembra de 2000 plantas de café, incrementando el área de producción, compra de fertilizante, abono y para cubrir gastos de mantenimiento de la finca.
Su plan es seguir ampliando el área de producción para generar mas ingresos y ayudar con la educación de su hijo y apoyo a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Leticia, 40, is married and has a son; she lives in the municipality of Las Vegas, Peña Blanca, Cortes.

Ana is very hardworking; she’s been growing coffee, plantain and corn for ten years that she sells in the local market.  The coffee she sells is in wet parchment stage, the plantain is by the bunch and the corn by the quintal.  All of her family has worked producing because it’s a way of life to be able to develop and educate her son because where they live is an area that’s apt for this product ion and selling coffee is a very profitable business in the country.

This 12,000 lempira loan is the first one she’s requested and it’s to invest in planting 2000 coffee plants increasing the planted area, to buy fertilizer and manure and to cover farm maintenance costs.  Her plan is to continue expanding the planted area to generate more income and to help with her son’s education and family’s support.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Marina Reina

texts.es:
Doña Marina, tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad que ya se independizaron, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Hace 6 años que doña Marina decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de ropa nueva para niños y adultos y ropa interior. También vende otros artículos de temporada. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y lo ha mantenido estable mediante préstamos. Ella necesita acondicionar bien un local solo para el negocio, y para eso solicita un préstamo de 10,000.00 Lempiras para comprar una cortina de metal corrediza y verjas de hierro, lo que le permitirá tener en un solo lugar la mercadería. Ha solicitado a ODEF diez préstamos con el actual. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y poder establecer otro centro de ventas en otro lugar y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marina, 54, is married and has two adult children who are already independent.  She lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

Six years ago Marina decided to start her own business selling new clothes for children and adults and underwear.  She also sells other seasonal items.  She has the business at home and has kept it stable by means of loans.  She needs to set up a space for the business only and needs a 10,000 lempira loan to buy a sliding metal curtain and iron grills which will allow her to have a space just for her merchandise.

She’s asked ODEF for ten loans counting the present one.  Her goal is to make the business grow and to be able to set up another sales point somewhere else and to improve her income.

loans.use: to remodel a space at home to set up her business.

loans.name: Esperanza 1 Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Esperanza 1, es de la ciudad de Concepción, está integrado por 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras, en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican por más pequeña que sea.
Maria es miembro del grupo, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo. Cuenta que al empezar le ha sido un poco difícil, pero que después ya gano un poco de experiencia y que luego ya le fue un poco más fácil. Ahora ya tiene muy buena clientela y buena venta, y le está yendo muy bien.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá surtirse y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named “Esperanza 1” (Hope 1) is in the city of Concepción.  It is comprised of 15 very hard-working women.  All of them have a small business activity that they devote themselves to no matter how small it is.

Maria is a member of the group.  She tells us that she sells all types of clothes.  She says that starting out was a little difficult.  Then she got a little experience, and it became a little easier for her.  She now has very good clientele and good sales.  It is going very well for her.

She is requesting the loan to buy all types of clothes.  She will be able to stock up with the clothes, and this way she will be able to continue offering a variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago, tiene 39 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea de San Juan Pueblo, Tela.
 hace 6 años se propuso tener una fuente de ingresos fijos para  la manutención de su familia, desde entonces que estableció una pulpería para la venta de productos alimenticios de la canasta básica familiar como ser, granos básicos, manteca, huevos, productos de limpieza, embutidos refrescos, lácteos, carnes etc. 
Santiago ha solicitado su primer préstamo  de 20,000 lempiras para surtir su negocio, donde ha podido aumentar los ingresos necesarios  en compra de  productos como granos básicos, lácteos y refrescos. Todo su esfuerzo es para lograr obtener ingresos que le permitan darle buena educación a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Santiago, 39, is married and has three children; he lives in a village in San Juan Pueblo, Tela.

Six years ago he decided to have a steady source of income to support his family and since then opened a grocery store to sell basic staple items like basic grains, lard, eggs, cleaning supplies, cured meats, soft-drinks, dairy products, meat, etc.

Santiago has asked for his first, 20,000 lempira, loan to stock his store where he’s been able to increase income necessary to buy products like basic grains, dairy products and soft-drinks.  All of his effort is to manage to obtain income that will allow him to give his children a good education and his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El Comité "San Miguel”, está conformado por 11 mujeres emprendedoras que viven en la Ciudad de  Curuguaty, son vecinas y todas ellas cuentan con una actividad fija es decir se dedican a la cría de animales como chancho, gallinas, vaca entre otros.
Norma es una de las miembros del grupo, ella es la presidenta y nos comenta que siempre trata de motivar a sus amigas para seguir trabajando y ayudarse las unas a las otras de esa manera. Norma se dedica a la venta de prendas, como ser remeras, jeans, camisas y demás, y es gracias a ese trabajo que ella puede ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan para un mejor estilo de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual desea poder tener más variedad y estilos de ropas, con lo que pretende tener más clientes.
texts.en:
The "San Miguel” committee is made up of 11 entrepreneurial women who live in the city of Curuguaty.  They are all neighbors and each one has her own business.  They raise animals such as pigs, hens, cows, etc.

Norma is one of the members of this group.  She is the group's president and she tells us that she always tries to motivate her friends to continue working and helping each other.  Norma's business is selling clothing such as t-shirts, jeans, shirts, etc.  Thanks to this work, she is able to help her family and provide them with everything they need in order to enjoy a better lifestyle.  She is requesting this loan to buy clothing as she would like to have more variety and a wider range of styles so that she can attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Doroteo

texts.es:
Doroteo vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima seco además de tener a las Líneas de Nazca, los cuales son geroglifos extenso en medio de un gran campo árido los cuales eran utilizados por la antigua cultura Nazca como un calendario Astronómico según algunos estudios. Doroteo vive al lado de su esposa y sus 4 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 24, 20, 18 y 16 años, a quienes mama muchísimo y por quienes se ha esforzado para darles una vida digna y sobre todo honrada y humilde de corazón y carácter. Cuando Doroteo tiene un tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música sobre todo música típica ya que es muy bonita, en algunas ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Seco de Cordero”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero a Doroteo le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser Ingeniero Agrónomo ya que le gusta mucho sembrar.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Doroteo trabaja en su parcela en la cual siembre Zapallo, el trabaja alrededor de 6 horas al día y sobre todo cuando le toca regar su cultivo se queda hasta 10 horas ya que tiene que verificar que el sembrío este bien regado, también tiene un pequeño negocio de molienda de alimentos balanceado con los cual tiene un ingreso mas para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque se esfuerza mucho y sobre todo es honrado.

Doroteo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo, así de esta manera el podrá mantener y cuidad su cultivo en buenas condiciones para tener una buena cosecha, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Crecer en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Doroteo lives in the city of Nazca, a city noted for its dry climate and for having the Nazca Lines which are extensive hieroglyphics in the middle of a huge, arid plain that according to some studies were used by the ancient Nazca culture as an astronomical calendar.

Doroteo lives with his wife and four children whose ages are 24, 20, 18 and 16 years who he loves very much and for whom he has striven to give them a proper, honorable life.  He’s humble of heart and character.  When Doroteo has any free time he likes listening to music especially traditional music because it’s very beautiful.  Sometimes he likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, the very delicious “Seco de Cordero.”  Due to poor economic resources he only attended secondary school but Doroteo would have liked to have studied Agronomy Engineering because he likes to plant very much.

With much effort and dedication, Doroteo works his parcel where he grows squash.  He works about six hours daily and when he has to water his crops he stays up to ten hours because he has to verify that the crops are well-irrigated.  He also has a small business grinding animal feed that produces additional income to cover household expenses.  He believes that he does well in his business because he works very hard and above all because he’s honest.

Doroteo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy manure and fertilizer for his crops in order to be able to care for and maintain his crops in good condition to have a good harvest which will allow him to continue striving towards making his greatest dream a reality: to grow in his business.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: David Gaudencio

texts.es:
El socio David pertenece al banco comunal LAS HIJAS DE MARIA;el socio continua trabajando con su negocio de venta de churros, el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone dia a dia ; el socio trabaja en su negocio conjuntamente con su esposa, el socio trabaja de forma ambulatoria por el centro de la ciudad,el socio desea poder continuar trabajando para de esta manera continuar apoyando a su familia.

El socio solicita el prestamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de churros como azucar y  harina.

El socio se siente agradecido por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
David belongs to the 'Las Hijas de Maria' community bank.  He continues in his business making 'churros'.  He has been in this business for years and he is doing well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work every day.  He works together with his wife.  David works as an itinerant vendor in the city center.  He would like to continue working so that he can continue helping his family.

David is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making churros such as sugar and flour.

David is grateful for the loan that he is receiving and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making 'churros' such as sugar and flour

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Potrero Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre kuña katupyry Potrero está trabajando en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y poder ayudar de esa forma a sus familias.
La señora Geronima que es la presidenta del comité, se dedica a la venta de verduras, y nos comenta que mediante su trabajo y la ayuda de su grupo ha podido mejorar un poco sus ingresos. Su sueño es poder tener una tienda grande, con lo cual podrá seguir creciendo y ser una gran microempresaria.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tomates, locotes, cebollas, pepinos y demás verduras, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y mejorando sus ingresos, y a la vez poder seguir luchando por su sueño.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry Potrero women's committee are on their second loan cycle within Fundación Paraguaya's entrepreneurial women's program.  They are very hard-working women who have a great desire to do well and help their families.

Geronima is the committee's president.  Her business is selling vegetables and she tells us that, through her work and with the help of her group, she has been able to improve her income a little.  Her dreams are to have a large store, continue growing her business and become a great micro-businesswoman.  She is requesting this loan to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, cucumbers and other vegetables.  This will enable her to continue working and improving her income.  She will also be able to continue working towards her dream.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mily

texts.es:
Mily es una joven de 29 años, vive al lado de su esposo y juntos tiene 3 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 2, 6, y 12 años, a los cuales quiere muchísimo y pro quienes trabaja  muy duro para darles lo mejor junto a su esposo el cual trabaja en su negocio de compra y venta de pescado. Cuando tienen un tiempo libre a Mily le gusta salir a pasear con su familia sobre todo para compartir junto a sus hijos y su esposo, asimismo le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo con papa a la huancaína”.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo entusiasmo Mily trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, cervezas y gaseosas, ella le dedica  a su negocio alrededor de 15 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es muy trabajadora.

Mily está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al gran apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio  como 5 sacos de arroz, 5 sacos de azúcar, cajas de leche, aceite, fideos, entre otros, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y una tienda”.
texts.en:
Mily is a young woman of 29 years of age. She lives with her husband and their 3 children who are 2, 6, and 12 years old. They mean a lot to her and she works very hard in order to give them the best along with her husband who works in the business of buying and selling fish. When they have free time Mily likes to go for walks with her family to enjoy sharing time together with her children and her husband. One of her favorite dishes is the tasty dish of rice, chicken, and potatoes served in a Huancaína sauce [sauce made with cheese, onions and yellow aji peppers].

With lots of effort and above all enthusiasm Mily works in her business selling groceries, beer and soft drinks. She works about 15 hours a day at her business and can assist 20 clients a day. She believes that her business is doing well because she is very friendly with the customers and above all is very hardworking. 

Mily is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and gives thanks to the great support they have given her so she could buy more merchandise for her business such as 5 bags of rice, 5 bags of sugar, cartons of milk, oil, noodles, and other items. This is the way she can improve her earnings and thus be able to keep fighting in order to attain her greatest dream: “to have her own house and a store.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise (bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of milk, oil, noodles, and other items

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida y tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza,ella vende lapiz labial,perfumes y cremas y el negocio de venta de comoda lo realiza en forma ambulatoria como estiofado de carne y pollo con arroz,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la comida.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos de belleza como lapiz labial,cremas y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia continues to devote herself to selling food.  She also sells beauty products.  She sells lipstick, perfume, and creams.  

She sells food like meat stew and chicken and rice in an itinerant manner.  She works from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  It is through these small businesses that she gets her children ahead.

She dreams of having a place where she could sell her food.

She is requesting the loan to buy beauty products like lipstick, creams, and perfume.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy beauty products like lipstick, creams, and perfume.

loans.name: Cesar German

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 46 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima seco además de tener a las Líneas de Nazca, los cuales son geroglifos extenso en medio de un gran campo árido los cuales eran utilizados por la antigua cultura Nazca como un calendario Astronómico según algunos estudios. En su tiempo libre a Cesar le gusta leer y sobre todo aprovecha la oportunidad apara comer un riquísimo Escabeche, es un platillo a base de cebolla y carne ya sea de pollo o de pescado acompañado de cebolla dorada en una salsa de ají, es su platillos favorito. Cesar solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Con esfuerzo y sobre todo entusiasmo Cesar trabaja en su negocio como agricultor, actualmente ha sembrado maíz amarillo en su parcela, le dedica a su cultivo alrededor de 7 horas diarias, también trabaja en un restaurante en horas de la noche y con ello tiene un dinerito extra para los gastos del hogar; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicado y sobre todo responsable con su sembrío ya que siempre está al tanto.

Cesar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá cubrir los gastos de abono, fertilizantes, riego de cultivo y también para poder cubrir los gastos de combustible del motor de extracción de agua de pozo ya que con esta agua riega el cultivo; así de esta manera el podrá dar un mantenimiento adecuado para su cultivo y así podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un terreno propio para sembrar”.
texts.en:
Cesar, 46, lives in the city of Nazca, a city noted for its dry climate and for having the Nazca Lines which are extensive hieroglyphics in the middle of a large, arid field that according to some studies were used by the ancient Nazca culture as an astronomic calendar.

In his free time Cesar likes to read and also takes advantage of the opportunity to eat a very delicious “Escabeche,” a dish based on onion and meat, either chicken or fish with onions fried in chili sauce; it’s his favorite dish.  Cesar only attended secondary school but would have liked to have studied a university career.

With effort and above all enthusiasm, Cesar works in his business in agriculture; he’s currently growing yellow corn on his parcel.  He spends about 7 hours daily and also works in a restaurant in the evening hours earning a little extra money for household expenses.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s very dedicated and above all responsible with his crops since he’s always watchful.

Cesar is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to cover costs of manure, fertilizer, crop irrigation and also will be able to cover costs of fuel for the motor to extract well water which is the water he uses to water his crops.  In this way he will be able to give his crops adequate care and continue to strive toward making his greatest dream a reality: to have a parcel of land of his own to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and fuel for the well pump.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La socia Elisa sigue perteneciendo  al Banco Comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Elisa, es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 9 años de edad; ella se sigue dedicando a la agricultura y a la ganadería. La socia Elisa sigue teniendo sus vacas, toros y sigue también en la crianza de animales menores. La socia Elisa en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para la compra animales menores como cuyes y gallinas.  

La socia Elisa agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Elisa is still a member of the "Virgen Concebida de Arin Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Arin district of the Calca province, department of Cusco.

Elisa has a live-in partner and a 9-year-old son. She still works in agriculture and stockbreeding. Elisa continues to raise cows and bulls, as well as small animals. At this time, Elisa needs this loan in order to purchase small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

Elisa would like to thank you for this loan, and she commits to making her payments according to her payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Yusup

texts.en:
Pak Yusup is an example of a Ruma enterpreneur in Bekasi. Initially, his main business was a shop selling grocery items such as rice, coffee, tea, sachets of milk, snacks, drinks, soap, and shampoo.  Then he added the first Ruma product which is prepaid cell phone airtime. Now, he wants to add the second product from Ruma, Loket Ruma. 

This new product (which requires the EDC machine) will make Pak Yusup's shop a payment point, where people can come and pay monthly bills, or buy prepaid electricity vouchers. The EDC machine will be used to do the payment transaction and create a receipt. The customers will receive the receipt as  proof that they have bought services or paid bills. 

By becoming a Loket Ruma agent, he hopes to increase his income. He hopes the new product will bring new customers to his shop who want to pay electricity bills, buy prepaid electricity vouchers, and buy Telkomsel prepaid cell phone airtime. 

Pak Yusup is married and has one toddler of age 2, a 5 year old, and a three month old. He really wishes that this business will bring in more money for the family.

loans.use: To pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for his bill payment business

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria tiene 38 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se encuentra en nuestra maravillosa selva y en la cual alberga a flora y fauna muy hermosa, es una ciudad en la cual se puede ver todo el esplendor de la naturaleza y donde podemos desconectarnos del ruido. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre Maria sale a pasear por las calles de su ciudad para despejarse y relajarse un poco y en ocasiones aprovecha para comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo con papa a la huancaína”. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesora de arte.

Día a día Maria sale a trabajar en su negocio de venta de cigarro mapacho, el cual está hecho a base de tabaco molido y canela  y lo usan las personas que viven en la selva como medicina o también para espantar a los zancudos y mosquitos de la zona, asimismo se puede masticar y sirve como una especie de laxante;  ella cree que le va bien en su negocio ya que es amable con los clientes.

Maria agradece el apoyo brindado por los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar más tabaco para poder ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ingresos con lo cual podrá seguir luchando  para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:    ” Tener una mejor calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
María, 38, lives in the city of Pucallpa, a city located in our wonderful jungle and which houses very beautiful flora and fauna.  It is a city where one can view nature’s entire splendor and where one can become disconnected from noise.  When she has free time, María goes out walking in her city’s streets to unclutter her mind and relax a bit and sometimes takes advantage to eat one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Arroz con Pollo con Papa a la Huancaína.”  She only attended secondary school but would have like to have studied to become an art teacher.

Day to day María heads out to work in her business selling ‘mapacho’ cigarettes [a very potent variety of tobacco; the high concentration of nicotine in its leaves makes it useful for creating organic pesticides] which are made based on ground tobacco and cinnamon and is used by people living in the jungle as medicine and also to repel mosquitos in the zone.  It can also be chewed and works as a type of laxative.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s polite to her customers.

María is grateful for the support provided by Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she will be able to buy more tobacco to be able to offer more products to her customers thus improving her income to continue striving to make her greatest dream a reality: to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of tobacco.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La socia Aurelia sigue perteneciendo al Banco Comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin”, El Banco Comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Aurelia, tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y  tiene 2 hijos. La socia Aurelia se sigue dedicando  a la atención de su picantería y donde elabora la rica chicha de jora. En esta oportunidad Aurelia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores y compra de maíz amarillo para la elaboración de chicha de jora que es el macerado del maíz.

La socia Aurelia agradece y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Aurelia still belongs to the communal bank “Virgen Concebida de Arin." The communal bank is located in the district of Arin, in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco

The member Aurelia is 36 years old and is living with her partner and has 2 children. Aurelia is still working taking care of her food stall where she makes the tasty “chicha de jora” [fermented drink made with yellow corn]. At this time Aurelia is asking for a loan in order to buy small animals and to buy yellow corn in order to make chicha de jora by pulverizing the corn.

Aurelia is thankful, and she promises to to make the payments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy small animals and yellow corn

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de libreria y tambien trabaja como asistenta social,la socia en sue negocio de libreria vende cuadernos,lapices,borradores y lapiceros,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hija,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de libreria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar mercaderia para su libreria como cuadernos,libros,lapiceros y borradores.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues dedicated to her bookstore and also works as a welfare worker.  In her bookstore she sells notebooks, pencils, erasers and mechanical pencils.  She works from 8am until 6pm and through this business supports her daughter.  Her dream is to expand and improve the bookstore.  She requests a loan to buy merchandise for her bookstore like notebooks, books, pencils and erasers.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Abahuje/mgnz Group

texts.fr:
Daniel fait partie du groupe Abahuje /Mgnz . Le nom du groupe signifie «s’entre aider». Il a 36 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 6 ans à 13 ans, dont 5 scolarises. Il a 2 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Daniel est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture de riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait agrandir ces  champs de riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Daniel is part of the Abahuje /Mgnz group. The name of the group means “helping one another”. He is 36 years of age and married with five children aged between six and 13 years of age. Five of his children are at school. In addition to his child he has two other people under his care. He attended three years of secondary school.

Daniel is a rice grower. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the labor expenses for his rice-growing business.

To expand his rice-growing business he plans to request other loans. Over the coming years he would like to expand his rice paddies to satisfy market demand. With his profits he plans to pay his children’s school fees and his family’s medical expenses.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers and pay the labor expenses for his rice-growing business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. Richard is the main income provider in the family.

In 2005, Richard opened his shop, where he sells all kinds of paintings. He now needs a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his tools and purchase the needed quantity of paintings for his shop. In that way, he will be able to respond rapidly to his customers’ demands and therefore earn higher returns. In the future, Richard plans to work as a wholesaler and sell paintings to neighboring shops.

loans.use: to renew his tools and purchase the needed quantity of paintings for his shop

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband and daughter appear in her Kiva profile photo instead.
 

Rana is 31 years old and married with four kids, two of whom are in school.
She has been tailoring t-shirts and trousers for two years.
Rana asked Ryada for funds in order to buy sewing machines and to start her own tailoring shop.
Her future ambition is to have her own clothing shop for sewing t-shirts and trousers and to develop a better life and provide education for her children.
Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 per cent of the start-up enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and to start her own tailoring shop

loans.name: Gie Ass Term Segaz N°1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Gie ass term segaz n°1" se compose de cinq femmes dont les trois sont mariées et les deux célibataires.Elles habitent le même quartier et se réunissent chaque fin de mois pour collecter des cotisations et rembourser leurs crédits.Elles s'activent dans le commerce de tissus, de sacs, de chaussures pour femmes et enfants et d'autres produits divers. La présidente du groupe (en rouge) est mère de six enfants dont trois filles et deux garçons.Elle a implanté devant son domicile une cantine dans laquelle elle expose ses marchandises.Ce commerce lui rapporte des revenus qui lui servent à prendre en charge ses propres besoins mais aussi à soutenir les études de deux de ses filles.Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce,les membres du groupe sollicitent un pret de 250000f pour acheter du tissu teint et des chaussures.La vente de ces marchandises leur permettra de prendre en charge leurs propres besoins ainsi que ceux de leurs enfants.
texts.en: The group "Gie ass term segaz no. 1" consists of five women of which three are married and two are single. They live in the same neighborhood and meet up at the end of every month to contribute to a fund and pay back their loans. They are active traders of fabric, bags and shoes for women and children as well as various other products. They are requesting a loan of 250,000f to buy dyed fabrics and shoes. The sale of these goods will enable them to take care of their own needs as well as the needs of their children.

loans.use: to buy dyed fabrics and shoes

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de confeccion,ella confecciona muñecas de tela y los vende en forma ambulatoria,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los trabajos de confeccion de muñecas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar materiales como tela e hilos para que confeccione las muñecas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Silvia, continues to make rag dolls and sell them as a street vendor. She works from 9:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. Through this business, she has been able to help her son get ahead in life. Silvia's dream is to have her own business space where she can sell her dolls. She is requesting this loan to purchase materials like fabric and thread to make dolls.

Our member is happy about this loan, and she commits to repay it on time.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread to make dolls.

loans.name: Sara María

texts.es:
Sara está solicitando un cuarto crédito, destacándose por su puntualidad de pagos mes a mes. Quiere invertir nuevamente en su granja de pollos por lo que renovó su crédito por un monto mayor gracias a su buen historial crediticio. 

Con el crédito anterior Sara compró pollos y alimento, sin embargo se dio cuenta que aún podía crecer más por lo que decidió hacer una nueva inversión. Ella ha visto un incremento en la producción de pollos con su operación crediticia anterior sin embargo espera que el crecimiento sea progresivo y los resultados se vean reflejados los siguientes seis meses.
texts.en:
Sara is requesting her fourth loan; she stood out because of her punctuality with her payments month to month.  She wants to invest in her chicken farm again which is why she renewed her loan for a larger amount thanks to her good credit history.

Sara used her previous loan to buy chicks and feed.  However, she noticed that she could grow still more so decided to make a new investment.  She has seen growth in chicken production thanks to her previous loan.  However, she expects that growth will be progressive and results will be reflected in the next six months.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bovine cattle.

loans.name: Dulia Justina

texts.es:
La socia Dulia sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin”, El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco. La socia Dulia, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos de 18, 16, 12 años de edad.  La socia Dulia  se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo de patos, pavos, gallinas. En esta oportunidad Dulia requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. 

La socia Dulia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Dulia is still a member of the communal bank “Virgen Concebida de Arin."  This communal bank is located in the Arin district of Calca province, in the department of Cusco.  Dulia lives with a partner and has 3 children aged 18, 16 and 12.  Dulia has a business raising small animals such as: ducks, turkeys and hens.  At this time, Dulia needs a loan to buy small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens.

Dulia appreciates this loan, and promises to pay off her loan according to the established payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and small animals.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Pykysyry Group

texts.es:
Las 14 integrantes del grupo son mujeres muy trabajadoras que se unieron con el propósito de poder mejorar sus vidas por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas. Son mujeres madres de familia que cada día luchan por el pan de cada día de los suyos.
Isabel es una de estas mujeres, ella se dedica a la venta de leche y queso, y comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que ella empieza desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana todos los días, pero está contenta con lo que hace, ya que gracias a este trabajo ayuda mucho a su familia. Su meta es poder tener un gran tambo y de esa forma tener mayor producción de leche.
Isabel solicita el crédito para la compra de leche y de queso, con lo que desea poder tener una buena cantidad de los productos que vende, para que así, por medio de su trabajo siga creciendo
texts.en:
The fourteen members of the group are very hardworking women who joined together with the purpose of being able to improve their lives through their teamwork.  They are women who are mothers of families who struggle daily to provide daily bread for their loved ones.

Isabel is one of these women.  She sells milk and cheese and comments that it’s a very demanding job since she must start working from the wee hours of the morning every day.  But she’s happy with what she does because thanks to this work she helps her family very much.  Her goal is to be able to have a large milking yard in order to have greater milk production.

Isabel is asking for the loan to buy milk and cheese to have a good amount of the products she sells so that she can continue growing by means of her work.
