Juan tiene un lavadero para automóvil desde hace 13 años. Anteriormente él trabajaba para otra persona pero con el tiempo fue adquiriendo sus propias herramientas y así se independizo, y ahora tiene su propio lavadero.
El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de productos de limpieza que estaría utilizando en su negocio, y quiere aprovechar la oferta que le están ofreciendo de comprar al por mayor. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Juan is 33 years old, he lives in the town of Itá with his wife, who is a housewife and who cares for and educates their 3 children with deep love.
Juan has been running a carwash for 13 years. He previously used to work for another person, but in time he has succeeded in buying his own tools and in making himself independent, and he now runs his own carwash.
The loan he is requesting will be use to buy cleaning products he will use for his activity, wanting to take advantage of an offer he has received to buy product at wholesale price.
He is grateful for the chance he has received, as this will be very useful for him.

loans.use: To buy cleaning products.

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu is the mother of two children who both attend school.  She has been selling fried potatoes from her home to her neighbors and passersby for the past four years. Sikukuu dreams of opening a café in the future and of being able to spend more on food over the month. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to loans.  With this loan, she intends to purchase sacks of potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Grupo Triunfador Group

texts.es: Banco comunal está formado por 9 emprendedores Este grupo ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000,el  cual han demostrado que son responsable y que sus objetivos es crecer con sus negocios, ellos a pesar que tienen actividades económicas diferentes, en la actualidad ellos han que gracias al financiamiento han aumentado su inventario y esto ha permitido que tengan mayores clientes en sus negocios. Juana es una de los miembros y es la presidente de la AC la cual se encarga de motivar al resto de sus compañeros para que salgan adelante. Juana sus actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería que anteriormente solicito para aumentar su inventario. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para abastecer el negocio y ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad de productos de uso en el hogar como granos básicos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergente, jabón, gaseosas, jugos, huevos, queso, entre otros.
texts.en:
The communal bank has nine entrepreneurs. The group has had a loan with Fundación León 2000.  The group has demonstrated that they are responsible. Their objective is to grow with their businesses. They have different businesses. Currently, thanks to the loan, they have increased their inventories. This has allowed them to have more customers use their businesses. Juana is one of the members of the communal bank. She is also the president. She motivates the other partners to make progress. 
Juana has a store as a business. Previously, she requested a loan to increase her inventory. Now she is requesting a loan to stock up her business in order to offer her customers a variety of products. The products include things like basic grains, rice, sugar, oil, detergent, soap, soft drinks, juices, eggs, cheese and other items.

loans.use: like basic grains, rice, sugar, oil, detergent, soap, soft drinks, juices, eggs, cheese and other items.

loans.name: Jhonnatan Leonel

texts.es:
Jhonnatan  es un joven de 20 años,  muy emprendedor  y trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, caracterizada por sus hermosas playas y clima cálido; en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones le gusta preparar su plato favorito la "Carapulcra con Sopa Seca" para compartir gratos momentos con su familia; con mucho esfuerzo concluyó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos no pudo estudiar una carrera universitaria, pero sueña con poder lograrlo algún día.
Jhonnatan trabaja como ayudante de soldadura en una empresa de su ciudad, él dedica a su trabajo un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, tiene grandes habilidades como soldador y se siente muy a gusto desempeñando su labor.
Jhonnatan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, como es el pintando y mejoramiento de su cuarto; de esta manera podrá tener mayor comodidad y bienestar, logrando fomentar un ambiente agradable para su desarrollo, ya que sueña con cumplir en un futuro no muy lejano su deseo de poder estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Industrial y ser un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
Jhonnatan is a very enterprising and hard-working young man aged 20. He lives in the city of Chincha, which is known for its beautiful beaches and warm climate. In his free time he likes to listen to music and, on occasions, to prepare his favorite dish, “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca” [Pork and Chicken Stew with Dry Soup”] to share good moments with his family. With much effort, he completed his secondary school studies but, lamentably, due to scarce resources, he was unable to pursue university studies, although he dreams of being able to achieve that some day. 

Jhonnatan works as an assistant solderer at an enterprise in his city. Daily, he dedicates approximately 8 hours to his work. He has great ability as a solderer and he likes doing this work very much.

Jhonnatan is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they offer, he will be able to make improvements to his residence, such as painting and improving his own room. In this way, he will be able to enjoy greater comfort and wellbeing, achieving an agreeable atmosphere for his personal development, given his dream of studying at the university to be an industrial engineer and become an accomplished person.

loans.use: to make improvements on his house, especially on his room, including painting.

loans.name: Ruth Marina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y tambien sigue trabajando como cocinera,la socia los cuyes lo vende en forma ambulatoria,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y alimentos para los cuyes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues with her business of raising animals, such as guinea pigs. She also continues in her job as a cook. The member sells the guinea pigs as a street vendor, which helps her get ahead. Her dream is to expand her business of raising animals. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and the appropriate feed.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en: Mwanatumu is taking out another loan to start a new business. She intends to sell charcoal and coconuts. With the loan, she will be able to purchase sacks of charcoal and more coconuts for sale. Since her previous loan, her business has been doing well, and she has managed to save and start these new businesses. Her dream of establishing a restaurant is still ringing in her mind.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and more coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 5 filhos todos maiores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhos e 1 neta que vivem com ela. 	
É negociante dono do próprio negócio de venda de produtos diversos, e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, capulanas, sapatilhas, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é sustentar os Estudos dos filhos na Universidade.
texts.en:
Isabel is widowed and mother to 5 children, all of whom are adults.  She owns the home where she lives with her family, and she also supports 2 nephews and a granddaughter who live with her. 

Isabel is a businesswoman.  She owns her own business selling diverse items.  With this loan she plans to purchase products (soft drinks, sarongs, shoes, etc.) to increase her stock of merchandise.  In the future she would like to grow her business and improve her family's living conditions.  For this purpose, she promises to make her loan payments on time in order to request additional loans from Hluvuku.  

Her challenge is to be able to support her children's university studies.

loans.use: to buy products for sale (soft drinks, sarongs, shoes, etc.)

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady est une femme mariée commerçante  qui  évolue dans le secteur depuis 2009. Elle s’active  dans la vente de tissus et de parfums en provenance d’un pays voisin du Sénégal. Elle a choisi  cette activité dans le but de se procurer des revenus qui lui permettent de supporter les charges de sa famille. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et de parfums destinés à la vente. Elle consacre 5 heures de temps de la journée à son activité. Son objectif principal est de développer d’avantage son activité de commerce pour accroitre ses revenus  et parvenir à améliorer les conditions  alimentaires de sa famille. Son souci et de devenir  indépendante financièrement.
texts.en: Khady is a married woman and has been a retailer since 2009. She sells fabrics and perfumes which come from one of Senegal's neighbouring countries. She chose this business with the aim of earning an income that would enable her to take care of her family's expenses. She is a member of a UIMCEC branch and is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs with which to buy fabrics and perfumes destined for resale. She spends 5 hours a day on her retail business. Her main aim is to further develop her retail business so that she can increase her profits and manage to improve her family's food conditions. Her concern is to become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Dienaba

texts.fr:
CE MEMBRE HABITE LE MÊME VILLAGE QUE LES AUTRES MEMBRES. ELLE FAIT LE COMMERCE COMME ACTIVITÉ ET ELLE EST MEMBRE DU BANC VILLAGEOIS DEPUIS SA CRÉATION A SAVOIR LE 06 JUIN 2001.

ELLE VA S APPROVISIONNER EN VILLE POUR ENSUITE LES REVENDRE AVEC UNE PETITE MARGE DE BÉNÉFICE CAR LE VILLAGE A TOUT RÉCENT UNE BOUTIQUE.

ELLE VA ACHETER UN SAC DE SUCRE ET UN BIDON D HUILE ET UN SAC DE VÊTEMENT QU ELLE REVENDRE EN DÉTAILLE.

ELLE VISE A ASSURE LA SUBSISTANCE DE SA FAMILLE EN NOURRITURE ET SANTE, TOUT EN LAISSANT UNE MARGE DE BÉNÉFICE POUR RENFORCER SON ACTIVITÉ
texts.en: This "banc villageois" member comes from the same village as the other members. She is a retailer and has been a member of the "banc villageois" since its creation on the 6th of June, 2001. She gets her supplies in town and later resells them at a small profit as the village has only recently got a shop. She will buy a bag of sugar, a can of oil and a bag of clothing that she will resell, retail. She aims to take care of her family's food and health needs, whilst still retaining some of her profits with which to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil and clothing.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en: Tabu is married and the father of three children, all of whom attend school. He lives with his family in a house that has has neither electricity nor piped-in water, and his greatest monthly expense is food for his family. For the past two years, he has operated a poultry business, selling items from his home to neighbors and to restaurant operators. He dreams of expanding his business to earn more money and live a better life. Tabu joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business, and is requesting a loan for KES 15,000 to buy chicks and chicken feed for his business.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed for his business.

loans.name: Central Dos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Central Dos, está integrado por cinco mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras.
Todas ellas son originarias de la Ciudad de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca, una comunidad rica en gastronomía uno de sus platillos es el caldo de iguana y tacos de chicatana (hormiga roja). 
Todas las integrantes de este grupo trabajan en la central camionera de su comunidad desde hace diez años, que fue cuando se fundo la central.
La representante de este grupo es la señora Elena de treinta y seis años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos como enchiladas, quesadillas, pizzas y tortas.
Dice que lleva vendiendo trece años, y que anteriormente vendía sus antojitos mexicanos en las calles de su comunidad.
Una de las razones por las cuales decidió vender comida es por que no estudió y no encontraba trabajo, pero necesitaba darles de comer a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera; tiene tres hijos Miguel, Rubí y Gabriel quienes les ayudan saliendo de la escuela, mientras ella esta en el puesto, ellos van a ofrecerle comida a los choferes y a los pasajeros. 
A las siete de la tarde, ya cuando es el último recorrido de las camionetas y se cierra la central sus hijos y doña Elena recogen lo que utilizaron y dejan limpio para que al día siguiente vuelva otra vez a vender y sus clientes encuentren el local limpio.
Una de las cosas que la hacen sentir bien es la ayuda que le ha dado fundacion, ya que va a poder comprar más ingredientes para la elaboración de antojitos mexicanos.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son:

Maria Guadalupe- quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
Gloria Itzayana-quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
Reynalda-quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
Martha Angélica-quien se dedica a la venta de comida.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a todas las mujeres.

***Esta foto se tomó en una central camionera, donde siempre hay mucha gente en los comercios, es por eso que se puede ver a más personas cerca de las integrantes del grupo. Sin embargo, los miembros son solamente quienes están mirando a la cámara (excepto la niña que está tomando jugo, ya que ella es hija de la señora Maria Guadalupe y la señora que está a la derecha, quien es conocida de las integrantes).
texts.en:
The group, “Central Dos,” is made up of five entrepreneurial, hardworking women, all of whom are from the city of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca, which is known for its rich cuisine. One of the traditional dishes is an iguana stew, and another is chicatana tacos (red ant tacos). 

All the members of the group have worked at the central bus station in their community for over ten years, since the creation of the station. Elena is the representative of this group. She is 36 years old, and makes a living selling traditional Mexican foods, such as enchiladas, quesadillas, pizzas and tortas. She has been selling food for 13 years, and before she began working in the bus station, she sold food in the streets of her community. 

One of her reasons for starting her food sales business was her lack of education and therefore her inability to find work. She was a single mother who needed a way to feed her three kids, Miguel, Rubí and Gabriel. Her children help her make and sell food when they finish school in the afternoon, and they offer food items to the drivers and passengers who pass through the terminal. 

At seven in the evening, when the vans and buses make their final trips and the station closes, Elena and her children clean their food stand and the surrounding area, so that the next day their customers will find the place clean and orderly. Elena is grateful for the support she has received from Fundación Realidad (Reality Foundation), and she plans to utilize the support from the loan to purchase ingredients for making traditional Mexican food dishes.

The other group members are:

Maria Guadalupe – food sales
Gloria Itzayana – food sales
Reynalda – food sales
Martha Angélica – food sales

The groups members are thankful to Fundación Realidad for their support.

***This photo was taken at the bus terminal, where there are always many people buying and selling various goods, and those people appear in the background of the group photo. However, the group members are the only people who are looking at the camera (except for the girl who drinking juice; she is Maria Guadalupe’s daughter. Maria Guadalupe is the woman at the far right in the photo).

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making food items.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is married with two children who both attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Juma has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business from home to the market. He cites seasonality as his major challenge, especially during rainy season, when it becomes hard to operate. He dreams of expanding to acquire more motorcycles in the future. 

Juma is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle and establish a barber shop. He joined to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle and establish a barber shop.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincial de Inhambane, fez a 7ª classe, solteira de 42 anos vive na casa própria com sua família e responsabiliza se pela sobrinha que vive com ela em sua casa. 
Trabalha no Centro Social da EDM a mais de 10 anos como auxiliar, trabalha das 7h as 17h tendo um salario que aplica nas despesas da casa e da sua obra, para além do trabalho tem tido horas extras que aplicara também no reembolso do empréstimo na tentativa de terminar mais rápido para aceder a outro.
Este é seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuvku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção nomeadamente: (cimento, blocos e areia) para fazer o reboco na sua sala de estar. Esta confiante que vai pagar o crédito cem problema, apesar da falta de água que dificulta a sua obra.
texts.en:
Carolina was born in the province of Inhambane.  She completed school through the 7th grade.  She is single and 42 years old. She lives in her own home with her family and supports a niece who lives with her.   

For over 10 years she has worked at the social club of the EDM (Mozambique electric utility) as an assistant.  She works from 7am to 5pm and receives a salary that she uses for household expenses and construction of her home. In additional to her work she has had overtime which she will also use to pay back her loan in an intent to pay it off more quickly and have access to another one. 

This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction materials (cement, blocks, and sand) in order to finish the interior walls of her living room.  She is confident that she will pay off the loan without any difficulties, despite the lack of water that makes her construction project more difficult.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, blocks, and sand).
